intro: Ternstroemia ekmanii, commonly known as the Kauaʻi hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauaʻi in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Ternstroemia ekmanii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is considered an endemic species.
